_comment: Created by ianb on 01/10/2014 11:47:47 using v2.1
title: Have there been changes in support for community mental health service users?
analysis_commentary:
This question assessed how well patients felt that NHS mental health services supported them with various aspects of their lives. Physical health needs were the best supported area, with the lowest proportion of patients reporting that they did not receive enough support (35% in 2014). Help with finding or keeping work was consistently the least supported area, with 44% of patients in 2014 reporting that they did not receive enough support. Performance worsened in all areas between 2013 and 2014, with the exception of support with physical health.

Please note that respondents were not asked about care responsibilities in 2014.
data_source: Care Quality Commission, Community Mental Health Survey
